question: Given, a current carrying wire of non-uniform cross-section, which of the following is constant throughout the length of wire?
choices: Current, electric field and drift speed
explanation: In a series circuit (wire), charge conservation ensures that the Current (I) is the same at all cross-sections.
Current density <katex>$J = I/A$</katex>, Electric field <katex>$E = \rho J$</katex>, and Drift velocity <katex>$v_d = J/ne$</katex> all depend on Area (A), so they vary.
